Package com.rapidminer.belt.table

Class ColumnSelector

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.rapidminer.belt.table.ColumnSelector
  • public final class ColumnSelector
extends java.lang.Object
    Allows to select columns that satisfy certain properties. Example usage: selector.ofCategory(Category.NUMERIC) .withMetaData(ColumnRole.LABEL) .labels().

    This class is not threadsafe. If adding filtering properties from different threads is required, appropriate synchronization must be used.

    Author:
    Gisa Meier

    • Method Detail

      • ofTypeId

        public ColumnSelector ofTypeId​(Column.TypeId typeId)
        Adds the requirement to the selector that all selected columns must have the given type id. Calling this method twice with different type ids leads to no results since every column has a unique type id.
        Parameters:
        typeId - the type id to filter by
        Returns:
        the column selector to enable chaining
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if typeId is null

      • notOfTypeId

        public ColumnSelector notOfTypeId​(Column.TypeId typeId)
        Adds the requirement to the selector that all selected columns must not have the given type id. Calling this method twice with different type ids leads to results where the type id is neither the first nor the second specified type id.
        Parameters:
        typeId - the type id to filter out
        Returns:
        the column selector to enable chaining
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if typeId is null

      • ofCategory

        public ColumnSelector ofCategory​(Column.Category category)
        Adds the requirement to the selector that all selected columns must have the given category. Calling this method twice with different categories leads to no results since every column has a unique category.
        Parameters:
        category - the category to filter by
        Returns:
        the column selector to enable chaining
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if category is null

      • notOfCategory

        public ColumnSelector notOfCategory​(Column.Category category)
        Adds the requirement to the selector that all selected columns must not have the given category. Note that calling this method twice with different categories leads to results where the category is neither the first nor the second specified category.
        Parameters:
        category - the category to filter out
        Returns:
        the column selector to enable chaining
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if category is null

      • withCapability

        public ColumnSelector withCapability​(Column.Capability capability)
        Adds the requirement to the selector that all selected columns must have the given capability. Calling this method twice with different capabilities leads to results with only columns that have both capabilities.
        Parameters:
        capability - the capability to filter by
        Returns:
        the column selector to enable chaining
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if capability is null

      • withoutCapability

        public ColumnSelector withoutCapability​(Column.Capability capability)
        Adds the requirement to the selector that all selected columns must not have the given capability. Calling this method twice with different capabilities leads to results which have neither the first nor the second specified capability.
        Parameters:
        capability - the capability to filter out
        Returns:
        the column selector to enable chaining

      • withMetaData

        public ColumnSelector withMetaData​(ColumnMetaData metaData)
        Adds the requirement to the selector that all selected columns must have the given meta data. Calling this method twice with different meta data leads to results which have both meta data. If both meta data is of the same type with ColumnMetaData.Uniqueness.COLUMN the result is empty.
        Parameters:
        metaData - the meta data to filter by
        Returns:
        the column selector to enable chaining
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if metaData is null

      • withoutMetaData

        public ColumnSelector withoutMetaData​(ColumnMetaData metaData)
        Adds the requirement to the selector that all selected columns must not have the given meta data. Calling this method twice with different meta data leads to results where the meta data is neither the first nor the second specified meta data.
        Parameters:
        metaData - the meta data to filter out
        Returns:
        the column selector to enable chaining
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if metaData is null

      • withMetaData

        public <T extends ColumnMetaData> ColumnSelector withMetaData​(java.lang.Class<T> type)
        Adds the requirement to the selector that all selected columns must have the given meta data type. Calling this method twice with different types leads to results which have meta data of both types.
        Parameters:
        type - the type to filter by
        Returns:
        the column selector to enable chaining
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if type is null

      • withoutMetaData

        public <T extends ColumnMetaData> ColumnSelector withoutMetaData​(java.lang.Class<T> type)
        Adds the requirement to the selector that all selected columns must not have the given meta data type. Calling this method twice with different types leads to results where the type is neither the first nor the second specified type.
        Parameters:
        type - the type to filter out
        Returns:
        the column selector to enable chaining
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if type is null

        Returns:
        the columns selected by this selector

        public java.util.List<Column> columns()

      • toColumnList

        public static java.util.List<Column> toColumnList​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> labels,
                                                  Table table)
        Selects the list of columns associated with the given list of labels from the table.
        Parameters:
        labels - the labels of the columns to select
        table - the table to select the columns from
        Returns:
        the columns list
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the table is null or the list is or contains null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the list contains labels that are not contained in the table
